reviews.review_msg: Best prof ever. He is nice. You dont need the textbook if you always attend his class. His notes are awesome.
he is one of the best teachers i had so far. you cannot miss his class for sure. But he is no longer teaching at sfu, I miss him

In fact, I took his class in 2009 but I STILL CAN REMEMBER HIS LECTURE CONTENTS.  He was the most hot prof I've ever seen!!!!! Definitely take him as prof whoever wants to get good grade!!! TRUST ME AND GO FOR IT.
He's a humourous prof I ever seen! He keeps his class interesting all the time...however, the content of Econ 105 is kinda hard to me lol. Anyways. difintely recommend!!
I love this prof so much!! He is the best prof I've seen. Every Everything is so clear and so helpful. Hoping to take his class again

The best prof I've ever had at SFU. I've been looking for another class he's teaching, but I haven't found one yet. He is extremely approachable, profound in his course subject, and very humorous. Don't miss it, you won't regret.
Absolutely Amazing Prof. Hard Work Will payoff. Too bad hes in Edmonton now.
He is an awesome prof. Very helpful during his office hours. I recommend taking this course with him, but his tests are very tricky. I really liked his teaching style
He is a very nice guy. He explains the course material very clearly. However, his exams are extremely tricky.

People expecting it to be easy, just be warned he is much harder now. Average on the first midterm was low (55%) and he gives a lot of trick questions to confuse you. Little work required outside of studying for exams, but they aren't easy.
Great proff. Don't buy the textbook, you don't need it. Willing to help students, very nice and easy going. A slight accent but still able to understand. HIGHLY recommend this proff.
You dont' need textbook for his class and his explaination is very clear. I like the way he teaches

A very nice prof. The material is very clear and he makes everything easy to understand. You dont need the textbook. Make sure to copy down all his notes and do the assignments coz they are very similar to the exam questions he gives. If you are taking econ 105 take it with him.
Very nice guy. Always willing to help students. Even when students ask dumb questions, he answers kindly. He makes you to come to class. Fair exam. Make sure you take 105 with him.
Overall he's a good prof. Make sure you copy down all the notes and study well... or else "fill in the blank" in the exams are gonna be a killer.

He is an awesome prof. He is organized and he knows his materials very well. He is also very friendly and helpful. Be sure to attend his lectures, tutorials & do the assignments, his exams are very fair but class avg. is high.

I don't understand why people, especially girls are obsessed with him. He is a nice guy, not content wise, he doesn't teach much. You won't learn much in that class. If you like to be dismissed early, you are probably with the right instructor. But man, I wish he can teach more and don't let us go 10 to 20 minutes earlier most of the time.

Eldar is the man. Super nice. Super helpful. Always available for extra office hours. Notes are clear. No textbooks needed. However, this class is not a GPA booster. Take it only if you need it. All in all, if you need to take this class, take it with him!
"What's up everybody?" He's funny, notes are clear, easy graphs, clear concepts. I had him for my 2nd attempt in 105, jumped from D to B+!! He made my life so much easier*
"What's up everybody?" Best prof ever, so worth going lectures to. Make sure you take 105 with him! You won't regret it.

AWESOME prof! makes everything interesting & easy to understand (alot of pratical examples). does not use textbook, everything is from lectures. exams are fair but fill in the blanks are TRICKY! he's super nice, cheerful, just plain helpful. always open to questions in person, through email etc. he makes economics seem not boring :)
He is a good profeesor. exceet when he chooses to have fill in the blanks for his exams, then you are screwed.
the best prof I've ever had in SFU.
Hands down, the best prof/teacher, i ve ever had in my entire life. extremely helpful, and his jokes are funny. strongly recommend him.
excellent professor. extremely helpful and interesting.

BEST PROF EVER! All you have to do is attend class twice a week, take notes and learn and understand them inside out. There's no surprises anywhere! DO NOT buy the textbook becuz you never use it at all. Makes Econ 105 a piece of cake. I retook this class and it changed my D to an A =) Trust me, Prof's make a huge difference !!

That was Econ 105 not 103... One other thing - Exam short answer questions were very similar to assignment questions. My TA was ok - if you don't completely get it in tutorial, you're screwed. Multiple choice was twisted because there were no sample MC questions covered in Tut. I'm still a bit upset about this course.

this prof is amazing, take econ 105 with him for sure!! he is really funny and an all-around nice guy. he is always willing to help his students even outside of office hours. the only tough part is that the avg is very high (test questions are straight from weekly hmk questions) so make sure you know your stuff inside and out...do NOT buy the text

What an awesome prof! Everything on his exams come from his notes and weekly hw. You can transfer the weight of the mt to the final. He tries to make class fun and enjoyable, and seemingly he really cares about all his students. The tutorials are mandatory but lecture is not. The textbook is NOT necessary for his class! Do not waste money on it.

Macroeconomics is a really confusing topic. He does not explain things well enough. There is also too much memorization of formulas, understanding graph & explanations and math involved. Calculators not allowed, so when I make one math mistake (which marks rnt deducted), it makes my next question totally wrong. (which is dedcuted)

Nice prof. But the economics content itself is NOT EASY. His exams arent easy either, but off the lec notes. He does NOT post lec notes. Too much info covered in too lil time. Overall he talks fast & rushes things compard wif alot of other profs. NO GOOD! Avg is too high and scaling makes it unfair for those whose who do work hard. No text needed!
Very good professor! Highly recommended! He makes everything very clear, you don't even need to refer to the textbook! Must attend lectures, he's a very good lecturer!
Hands down the best econ prof ever, he doesn't need a textbook in fact he doesn't even need to teach the course in chronological order, he started with the hard stuff first.
He is the kind of teacher everyone would desire to have
He's sooo awesome and funny! Best prof I've ever had. Never fell asleep in his lectures, and I enjoy them all a lot. His jokes relating to the material makes everything enjoyable.
Easy Class ! Exams are fair just study everything in the notes...no tricks but do remember formulas that he doesn't do examples for or go into any detail about..they are usually on the exam.

Eldar is a pretty good econ prof. You do not need to buy the textbook. It's possible to get an A without it. His lecture notes are very helpful and all you need to do is read his lecture notes to do well on the exams. The exams are M/C and short answers, they're pretty easy too, get the answers from the lecture notes, not tricky. Highly Recommended
He's the best econ prof!!!!!take him for sure!!
i like him so much, a nice guy,easy exam. best econ prof ever.

Eldar is pretty funny, and extremely nice. He tries to remember the names in his tutorial and also extremely helpful. He made this course really enjoyable and manageable even though I took it only as a requirement.
His tests are all on the notes he gives in class. So if you attend class and do the question he gives its all good.
He's really nice, and he has a good sence of humour. Also, he's hot. Choose him!

He is so charming, shinning and funny. He is so hot that I can't help falling in love with him. PICK HIM! He is the best professor in ECON105. The best and most charming professor I have ever met in this world.
Don't need textbooks to pass this class. Exams are fairly easy.Great professor,great teaching.
Textbook is pretty useful in explanations & clarifications, I would recommend it!!! Study hard, he is a funny man!!!
AMAZING PROF !!!! EASY EXAMS !!! highly recommended

The multiple choice was a mind-game. Otherwise long answers are straight forward. This guy is is is ... pretty darn good! Don't bother buying the text, I barely touched it. Just go to his office hours! He is very friendly and compliments the students all the time.
Clear, concise, straight to the point. Exams are fair, right off of his notes and practice questions. Lectures are recorded. Awesome prof.

Eldar is my best professor at SFU thus far. He's definitely engaging with a humorous approach in his way of teaching. In addition, the difficulty level of his exams are extremely fair. They're all based on tutorial/inclass examples. Textbook is only recommended. Overall, I would definitely enroll into another one of his classes. BEST ECON PROF! =)

Awesome prof...first and second midterms are worth 20% and 30% respectively. 10% for the tutorials, and 40% for the final exam. He's very clear on the notes, he gives a lot of examples and the exam questions are similar to his examples. Very good prof, recommended

Excellent prof.  If you attend all the lectures and pay attention then you'll do great on the exams. He doesn't even use the text book and all of his lectures are recorded as well. He is very clear and makes a very boring subject, interesting.
funny guy
Best prof ever...hottest,funny guy makes the lec pretty interesting.Notes are very useful, the way he talks is very clearly, and he is extramely patient to help ppl.Overall, the best...
very good prof. really helpful
Great teacher who teaches the material well. The textbook is only used in tutorials for practice. Overall a great Economics teacher.

he wasn't THAT great people. Yes, he's a nice person, but common....instructing the entire course by writing on an overhead? And the textbook which was 'required' was expensive and ancient...Regan and Lipsey texts are incomprehensible to anyone who is not an expert in economics. Girls...you just think he's hot. I agree he is a very nice man
I think He is the BEST....:)

he is very clear while teaching. make sure you attend class cuz all the exams are totally based on the stuff he goes through in class. the book is only for clarification (which is not needed in his class)...loved this class.
dope prof =D recommend takin 105 with him for sure.

Reallllly Nice. He's so cheery in the morning saying hi to anyone that makes eye contact. The best econ prof out there- its my favorite subject now because of him!!! He's also the best teacher in teaching it. As well, he has a very interesting accent and good sense of humor. Finally, he is not bad on the eyes. At. All.

Reallllly Nice. He's so cheery in the morning saying to anyone that makes eye contact. The best econ prof out there- its my favorite subject now because of him!!! He's also the best teacher in teaching it. As well, he has a very interesting accent and good sense of humor. Finally, he is not bad on the eyes. At. All.
Helpful, funny, interesting!

To tell the truth, and before I go to his final exam, i say that this prof is one of the few best in SFU, I never sleapt in his class even when it was a morning class and i only had 3 hours of sleep sometimes. His notes are clear and he presents the material in an interesting way.All u need to do is attend the lectures & tut with intention to learn

Sehic is a great professor, knowledgeable, clear, very to the point, and makes a dull subject such as economics humorous to a large class of students at 8:30 in the morning. Excellent course, I highly recommend taking econ with him. The only thing that kind of frustrates me is his handwriting... well i've seen worse but still

Amazing prof. Clearly interested in the course and really knows his stuff. He is very charismatic and knowledgable, it makes it hard not to like the class alot! Definitly my favorite prof so far. He's easy on the eyes too!
GREATEST ECON PROF OUT THERE, YOU HAVE TO BE STUPID TO NOT DO GOOD IN HIS CLASS SINCE HIS NOTES ARE SOOO GOOD, ALL YOU HAVE TO DO IS LISTEN TO HIM IN CLASS AND YOU WILL KNOW, ALL YOU NEED TO!

Best prof. I have EVER had. Very funny, Very young (still in his 20's?) Makes the course material very intresting. Textbook is completly useless, so are the TA's... just follow what HE says and you will get 100% no problem.. AMAZING PROF! the old timers should really watch and learn how its done.

Prof Sehic is very humourous and excellent in teaching.  he won't let u fall asleep.  exams are only based on lecture materials. the textbook is just for practice, so u don't have to read the textbook at all, but u must attend every single class since he doesn't give online notes and since his notes are just way too helpful....

Awesome teacher. Easy to understand. makes lectures interesting because relates material to todays world. tough midterms but they really help for final exam. if you do poorly on the midterm you can make your next one worth twice as much
the best econ prof out there! if you have to take econ 105 it better be with him =)

Professor Emrul is a fantastic instructor. He does his best to keep the material and learning environment entertaining and interesting. He always is upbeat and has great chemistry with his students. The material was well presented and correlated well with the textbook. I would recommend him for any student interested in the field.

Took this course with emrul several terms ago. He was nice but course was tough for me. I recommend going to class everyday otherwise u will end up with a bad grade like me :( emrul works hard and cares for students. he is a good person.

Though the material was challenging, Emi tried his level best to help the class get a sound understanding of the course. He was generous with his marking and it was clear he wanted us to do well. His lectures would sometimes be dull, but he would always try to liven them up with a few jokes. Overall, he is a decent prof and a great person!

He loves economics, and that comes across in his lectures. Challenging class, but you do well if you attend lectures and tutorials, and study. Lots of material to cover. He gives you lots of opportunities to do well IF you show up for lectures. Sample questions are very helpful. He wants his students to do well.

I did ok in this class, not great. I really did not like the textbook as it was way too long, and I found the concepts weren't simply stated. Also, the final exam was supposed to be cumulative but focused on only the last few chapters...so I didn't do too well because I studied concepts that weren't even tested. Emrul is entertaining however.
Honest and a more-than-fair marker. :)

Extremely helpful and nice! He really wants the best for his students. He replies to emails within a day. His Midterms and finals were fair, as long as you attend lectures and read the textbook. However, he has a bit of an accent so it's hard to understand him at first. But overall he is an awesome prof and I would take another course with him!

The course was challenging, but with a positive work ethic one should do fine. The prof was nice, friendly, and understanding. Lectures, were useful and the prof always tried explaining concepts in the simplest way as possible, which made it easier of grasping econ theories. Assignments were useful and exams were fair. Def recommend prof
His lectures are quite boring frankly, and material is not super difficult. He's a very nice guy though, and he'll adjust your mark to the highest possible grade, so thats a bonus!

Class was challenging but if you apply yourself you will do fine. One of his best qualities is his ability to communicate with his students. Not at all patronizing or condescending, he talks to you like an equal. He is also much more in touch with the younger generation of students and did his best to make lectures entertaining.
Good teacher. Funny, interesting, easy to understand. Helped me get by in a difficult class.

His midterms are fair as he goes over sample questions with the class. The final was easy if you knew how to apply the concepts you learned to real world situations, and did the recommended assignments. Overall, I would def recommend this prof

Emrul has a wonderful personality and his humour made lectures enjoyable. However, lecture info was vague and he didn't go into detail as much as he needed to. His midterms and final were extremely fair, but time was a major issue for the midterms. Also, expectations for assignments were not clarified and TA marking was inefficient and horrible.

material isnt hard as long as your read the textbook, but the prof just make everything so complicated and hard.. midterms u only get 45 minutes to do it ( once u finish the last question u got no time to double check)..final 2 hours all case studies questions, WAY too hard!! not recommended

I do not recommend this prof. He barely teaches anything, just skims through slides and ends class as early as a whole hour. Don't get too excited about that, you'll be spending that extra time reading your book because you need to learn the material somehow! He seems friendly, but still. Avoid if possible.
